Our team's mission is to empower content interaction and creation using CV/CG related technologies. We are focus on cutting-edge R&D in areas like 3D reconstruction, human digitization, character animation, physically-based simulation, advanced rendering, image and video manipulation, 3D deep learning, light field capture and rendering, AR/VR applications, etc.  What you will do:   Design, architect and implement large-scale machine learning systems/infrastructure/services for computer vision, computer graphics and deep learning models.  Build cross-platform applications to explore new technologies and new product directions.  Work closely with research scientists to develop efficient algorithms and prototypes on various platforms.  Build automation frameworks and tools to ensure high engineering quality and efficiency.  BS in computer science or related technical field  Strong CS fundamentals (algorithms and data structures) and problem-solving skills  3+ years C/C++/Java/Go/Python experience and solid software engineering background.  Experience in large-scale machine learning backend; familiar with RPC frameworks and key-value storage systems.  Experience dealing with concurrent systems and architectures.  Experience with standard deep learning frameworks. Quantcast is seeking Senior Machine Learning Engineers to join the Modeling Platform team in our Seattle or San Francisco office.                  As the real-time pulse of the Internet, Quantcast runs one of the world’s most substantial AI-driven insights and measurement platforms, directly quantifying over 100 million web destinations. Using machine learning to complement and enhance human knowledge, Quantcast provides marketers and publishers with meaningful audience insights, predictive targeting and measurement solutions throughout the customer journey.                  As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will use our large datasets, computational power, and analytic tools to build high quality and diverse products to support Quantcast’s position as a leader in advertising. You will help lead our efforts in designing, implementing and operating large-scale machine learning systems in a production environment.                  The Modeling team is developing groundbreaking platforms and algorithms to combine our vast first-party dataset with third-party data to provide the highest quality demographic and behavioral analysis of digital audiences on the market.                    Responsibilities:             Develop highly scalable models for prediction, inference, ranking, and recommendation demonstrating machine learning, statistics, and rule-based algorithms.  Identify fundamental questions in a given technical problem, come up with feasible solutions, and evaluate results to determine a sound final solution.  Participate in the full modeling lifecycle including (but not limited to) data analyses, model prototyping, production coding, model deployment, and performance monitoring to address large-scale and complex inference problems.  Effectively handle tasks and priorities to deliver quality at scale.  Work multi-functionally with data, infrastructure, and operations teams.  Mentor junior engineers to grow their skills.                          Qualifications:             MS in Computer Science or a related technical field with 5+ years of industry experience (or, BS with 8+ years)  Work experience in data analytics and common ML algorithms  Highly qualified in Python programming  Proficient in SQL programming  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  Experience mentoring and developing junior ML engineers/scientists                         #LI-AC1                  Quantcast is an advertising technology company and the creator of an innovative intelligent audience platform that empowers brands, agencies and publishers to know and grow their audiences online. Our solutions are leveling the playing field for our customers when it comes to effectively reaching audiences online and helping them power a thriving free and open internet for everyone. Founded in 2006 and headquartered in San Francisco, Quantcast has employees in 18 offices across 10 countries.                  We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone can be their authentic self. We work to ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.                  Recognizing the importance of flexible work environments, Quantcast adopted a hybrid work model in March 2022. This model gives employees the opportunity to work from home two days a week and work in the office for team collaboration for the remainder of the time. Implementation of our hybrid model may differ based on location or team, so please consult with your hiring manager for further information. All hybrid employees can also work remotely for two weeks each year or, if eligible, apply for our fully-remote work program. To ensure the safety of everyone, all U.S. and Canada employees working from a Quantcast office or who meet clients are required to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Outside of these locations, we encourage all employees to get vaccinated.

Overview:     YOU:        You are a motivated program manager who has experience working with Customer Support teams, developing scalable processes, building communities, enabling cross-collaboration, and driving operational excellence.          You are extremely detail-orientated, highly organized, and self-sufficient with a bias for action. You are a high-energy self-starter that has a passion for building relationships, problem solving, and identifying opportunities for growth and positive change.              US:           We are a growing SaaS company that helps enterprises plan, analyze, and optimize their technology spending across traditional and cloud infrastructure. We are looking for team members to help us evolve and transform internal processes and workflows to help scale our Product, Engineering, and Support organization as we continue to grow. We are a global team, operating openly and transparently, striving to constantly improve through accountability of ourselves and others. Convoy is transforming the $800 billion trucking industry, where even 10 years ago, most truck drivers did not have smartphones and paper driver logs were common. In 2015, Convoy launched the digital freight movement with an open and fully connected marketplace for brands and manufacturers to work directly with freight carriers who move truckload shipments throughout the country. This ‘Digital Freight Network’ is powered by machine learning and automation, and supported by a broad, ever-growing set of features that benefit both sides of the marketplace.   We’ve been honored to work with some great companies, such as Unilever, The Home Depot, and Procter & Gamble. We’ve also been backed by world-class investors, including Google, YCombinator, Fidelity, Greylock, Generation IM, Lone Pine, T. Rowe Price, Baillie Gifford and the founders and CEOs of Amazon, Salesforce, eBay, LinkedIn, Expedia, Dropbox, Starbucks, and others. We are proud to have been named a CNBC Disruptor 50 Winner (3x), a Fast Company World Changing Idea, a LinkedIn Top Startup, a Forbes' Best Startup Employer, one of Fortune Magazine's 'Impact 20' list, a best place to work in Washington State, a BloombergNEF Pioneer winner, and more.   This is your opportunity to collaborate with an incredible group of people and help transform the freight industry. Join Convoy and help us transport the world with endless capacity and zero waste.   As an IT Applications Manager, Collaboration Systems at Convoy, you are eager to get your foot in the door at a fast-paced, rapidly growing startup. As a member of the IT Applications team, you will play a critical role in managing systems that foster collaboration for all Convoy employees.  You Will:   Identify opportunities for application implementation, redesign, or process improvement; focused on the Google Workspace ecosystem, Slack, and Zoom.  Take ownership of the application support experience, including: documentation, education and escalations.  Partner directly with our Systems & Security teams to maintain application security controls, our AV group with Zoom Rooms deployment and management, and other key business units in relation to Collaboration initiatives.  Stay current with new functionality in Google Workspace, Slack, & Zoom to oversee routine updates, drive the deployment of new features and offer designed solutions to business problems.  Build a strong technical culture around our business systems that emphasizes technical excellence, rapid iteration, strong security, and frictionless user experiences.   We’re looking for someone who has:   3+ years of experience administering Google Workplace  At least 2+ years of experience administrating Slack in an enterprise environment OR 2+ years of experience administering enterprise level Zoom deployment.  Proven functional experience with business units and systems that enhance employee experience and effectiveness: Workplace, People, Learning & Development, Recruiting, Security, Infrastructure and more.  Developed application strategies for Groups, Calendar and room resources, collaboration for hybrid meeting in a “digital first” environment.  Must demonstrate strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills and the ability to collaborate in a team environment.  Strong communication skills, with the ability to clearly explain system changes and functionality to all workers across Convoy.   Benefits:  Employees' wellbeing is top of mind for the Convoy team. Outside of offering excellent medical, dental, and vision benefits, we also offer the following:  On demand mental and emotional health benefits through Lyra  On demand primary care through 98.6  Generous paid time off  Paid parental leave program  Fertility benefit solutions via Progyny  Child-care and adult/elder-care options through Bright Horizons  Opportunity to join and contribute to one of our Employee Resource Groups  Ability to make a real world impact!  Convoy is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. If you’re a passionate team player who wants to have an outsized impact on a diverse and dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you!

job_title: Ads Serving and ML Infra Engineer
job_Description: About Pinterest : Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It's where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you'll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You'll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.  Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that's uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our  PinFlex  landing page to learn more. Pinterest is one of the fastest growing online advertising platforms. Continued success depends on the Ad Serving & ML Infrastructure, which crunches thousands of signals in a few hundred milliseconds, to identify the most relevant ads to show to Pinners. You’ll join a small team that owns the scale, reliability, and developer productivity in a modern recommendation engine that has the highest QPS at Pinterest, highest number of developers, and which generates 100% of Pinterest’s revenue (> $3B/yr). This is a great opportunity for someone who is passionate about leveraging their infrastructure knowledge on one of the most complex and impactful systems at Pinterest.   What you’ll do:   Own a major component on a team that is rebuilding the Ads Serving framework and machine learning ecosystem from ground up in 2022. Everything is being redesigned in this high-performance recommendation platform supporting 100+ active developers per month. For example:  Ads Mixer Service: Rebuild the abstractions and business logic for key components within ads-serving, including feature expansion, candidate retrieval, filtering, ranking, auction, logging, testing and experimentation. Every single ad on Pinterest is served from this service, which is being rewritten from scratch this year.  Ads ML Platform: Own a significant component in the E2E Ads Machine Learning ecosystem, powering about 50 production models making hundreds of millions of predictions per second. This includes feature engineering, model training, and serving, while improving protection of user data (privacy preserving ML).  Performance and Reliability: Roll out modern CI/CD tooling (Bazel, Spinnaker, K8s, IDE), improve the robustness of our distributed serving and training architecture, and improve the latency, cost, and reliability of high-performance systems with millions of requests per second.  Developer Productivity - Develop data-driven tools used by 300+ employees per month, enabling people to iterate quickly on ML model improvements or understand changes in our marketplace. Additionally, partner with the Ad Quality team to accelerate projects that deliver significant Revenue and CTR metric gains.  Build an inclusive and collaborative team culture, by giving feedback on code + design docs, helping teammates solve problems, and mentoring others.   What we’re looking for:   1+ years of relevant industry experience.  Strong empathy for the pain-points faced by other engineers, and the passion to solve them.  Strong communicator and collaborative team player.  Natural intuition of engineering best practices, and enjoys helping others.  Mastery of at least one systems languages (Java, C++, Go).  Experience in, or interest in learning CI/CD tools, big data, distributed systems, performance tuning, machine learning, or full stack web development.   #LI-CN1 Our Commitment to Diversity:  At Pinterest, our mission is to bring everyone the inspiration to create a life they love—and that includes our employees. We’re taking on the most exciting challenges of our working lives, and we succeed with a team that represents an inclusive and diverse set of identities and backgrounds.  Not Specified 0

job_title: Mid Career Earth Scientist Research Platform Lead in Ecosystem Interfaces
job_Description: Mid Career Earth Scientist Research Platform Lead in Ecosystem Interfaces           Richland, Washington       Earth and Biological Sciences       Regular Full-Time       No       05/14/2022       3802                   Job Description           Overview             The Environmental Molecular Sciences Laboratory (EMSL) is a U.S. Department of Energy User Facility sponsored by DOE’s Biological and Environmental Research program, within PNNL’s Earth and Biological Sciences Directorate (EBSD). EMSL research focuses on fundamental biological and environmental research in collaboration with researchers from academia, other government laboratories, and industry. Scientists (“users”) around the world partner with EMSL scientists to use world-class laboratory space, expertise, and equipment through a peer-reviewed user science program. The successful candidate will lead the Ecosystem Interfaces Integrated Research Platform. Ecosystem interfaces host elevated rates of biogeochemical reactions and generate elevated fluxes of nutrients and other products that help to moderate ecosystem health, and response to climate change and land use. Understanding molecular-scale processes at these interfaces helps to elucidates large scale nutrient dynamics, identify rate-controlling reactions, and evaluate broader connectivity between ecosystems. Our ecosystem interface platform uses multiple laboratory and field techniques to quantify biogeochemical fluxes between critical zone, aquatic, atmospheric, and deep subsurface boundaries.                      The successful candidate will communicate with external scientists to coordinate scientific and technical aspects of their user projects with EMSL staff. They will rely on this familiarity with the user science to help develop and execute EMSL scientific strategy that aligns with the broader user research community. They will have the opportunity to mentor postdoctoral and graduate students as they pursue their own research projects as well.                      We are seeking an individual with expertise in cross-disciplinary research that integrates elements of modeling and experimentation across biogeochemistry, microbiology, and ecology. Topics of research experience may include but are not limited to:                 Studying biogeochemical, microbiological, metabolomic, or ecological processes of soils and belowground systems, with emphasis on molecular-scale dynamics.        Applying carbon decomposition or reactive transport modeling approaches in one or more of the following areas: (i) unsaturated zone processes and transient flow conditions, or (ii) biogeochemical oxidation-reduction reaction networks, including soil organic matter, metabolite, contaminant, or nutrient cycling/release/uptake.        Applying data science or machine learning approaches to physics-based models and uncertainty quantification.        Merging ecological concepts and theory with biogeochemical principles and models, with an aim to improve predictions of both ecological and biogeochemical dynamics.        Using stable isotope systematics to understand reaction pathways, quantify fluxes, and attribute provenance        Applying multi-omic analytics (e.g., proteomics, transcriptomics, and metabolomics) and bioinformatics to understand ecosystem processes                 This is a non-line management position that features opportunities for collaborative research with PNNL scientists whose expertise spans a broad range of environmental, material, and computational sciences. The successful candidate will have domain expertise in one and ideally several areas such as interfaces between subsurface/terrestrial, watersheds, coastal systems, and land-atmosphere zones, and will be expected to pursue team-based multi-disciplinary science. The successful candidate is expected to have a strong publication record and leadership qualities and demonstrated ability to work effectively and independently within a diverse group of investigators. They will also have opportunities to contribute to the mentoring and development of junior scientific staff. The candidate will have the opportunity to participate in setting national and/or international research agendas and will have obtained recognition via publications, awards, citations, or other honors.                            Responsibilities                   Being the scientific point of contact for EMSL users.        Coordinating technical advice about EMSL instrument capabilities for user proposal / questions        Providing technical guidance to users        Coordinating technical evaluation of user proposals in the review and acceptance process        Coordinating resources needed to support User Proposals        Conducting outreach with the user scientific community to define, develop, and align EMSL science directions, in partnership with the Science Area leads.        Organizing and implementing user-focused scientific workshops and summer schools to help define scientific research priorities, train the user community, and grow and develop the EMSL user community        Providing advice and feedback to management on EMSL project execution (lessons learned, call topics, integration meeting planning).        Partnering with Team Leaders to sustain and implement the EMSL S&T roadmap within the User program        Providing information needed for EMSL reports and strategy documents (workshop reports, strategy/planning documents, etc.).        Mentoring postdoctoral and graduate student researchers                       Qualifications             Minimum Qualifications:                 BS/BA with 5 years of experience        MS/MA with 3 years of experience        PhD with 1 year of experience                 Preferred Qualifications:                 One year of professional research experience post PhD        Our preferred candidate will have a PhD in a discipline that aligns with EMSL’s Ecosystem Interfaces team        Significant experience with laboratory experiments, field studies, or modeling within the context of environmental biogeochemistry, microbiology, and ecology with an emphasis on soils and belowground systems. This experience should be evident by a strong publication record. Experience with or knowledge of a DOE Office of Science or other federal agency User Facility program operations        Strong record of grant support and publication in science areas aligned to the EMSL Ecosystem Interfaces focus.                  Hazardous Working Conditions/Environment                   Magnetic fields        Biological samples        Chemical reagents and solvents        Field/off-site work (as needed)                             Additional Information             Not applicable.                      Testing Designated Position             This is not a Testing Designated Position (TDP)                      About PNNL             Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) is a world-class research institution powered by a highly educated, diverse workforce committed to the values of Integrity, Creativity, Collaboration, Impact, and Courage. Every year, scores of dynamic, driven people come to PNNL to work with renowned researchers on meaningful science, innovations and outcomes for the U.S. Department of Energy and other sponsors; here is your chance to be one of them!                 At PNNL, you will find an exciting research environment and excellent benefits including health insurance, flexible work schedules and telework options. PNNL is located in eastern Washington State—the dry side of Washington known for its stellar outdoor recreation and affordable cost of living. The Lab’s campus is only a 45-minute flight (or ~3 hour drive) from Seattle or Portland, and is serviced by the convenient PSC airport, connected to 8 major hubs.                      Commitment to Excellence, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Equal Employment Opportunity             Our laboratory is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment dedicated to solving critical challenges in fundamental sciences, national security, and energy resiliency. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. In support of this commitment, we encourage people of all racial/ethnic identities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities to apply for employment.                      Pacific Northwest National Laboratory considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), protected veteran status, and any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, and/or local laws.                                We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures and in employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, contact us at hr@pnnl.gov.                      Drug Free Workplace             PNNL is committed to a drug-free workplace supported by Workplace Substance Abuse Program (WSAP) and complies with federal laws prohibiting the possession and use of illegal drugs.                      Mandatory Requirements             Battelle requires employees to have a COVID-19 vaccine as a condition of employment, subject to accommodation. Applicants are required to disclose their vaccination status following a conditional offer of employment and must attest to being fully vaccinated with a Center for Disease Control (CDC)-approved COVID-19 vaccination, or provide documentation of need for medical or religious exemption from the COVID-19 vaccination requirement.

We are specifically looking for a candidate with experience in designing compelling interactions and experiences for AR/VR and synthesizing broad or solving ambiguous business requirements and accomplishing them through design or envisioning future emerging technologies. And who can work with a team of researchers who create the technology that makes AR pervasive and universal. Your work will be used in user research studies, technology demos, and proof of concept prototypes. job_title: Routing Science Program Mgr, Digital, Device, and Alexa Support
job_Description: Bachelor Degree     6+ years of relevant work experience in product/project/program management and/or operations in a customer service environment;     Experience leading cross functional efforts/programs     Job summary   If you're interested in machine learning and want to work on a science and analytics team that builds solutions that directly impact millions of customers worldwide, this job is for you!      Amazon revolutionized customer service, now we are changing what customers expect from technical support. We’re responsible for the Customer Service operations and solutions for all Amazon Devices and Digital properties, from the Kindle and Echo, to Amazon Music and Prime Video.      We are seeking an experienced Senior Program Manager to join the D2AS Global Customer Routing & Personalized Solutions Optimization (D2-GPS) Team within the Device, Digital and Alexa Support (D2AS) organization. You will be responsible for driving high-visibility programs that directly impact the customer experience globally. You will own and execute complex projects and programs, and will be seen as a thought leader and innovator within the organization.      Your primary focus will be to own strategic programs and interactions with functional leaders in the team. You will spend time with these stakeholders to better understand their needs and how to scale existing processes to accelerate inventing on behalf of our customers.      Key job responsibilities        In this role, you will:          Work closely with the Routing Science Product Manager, Scientists, Engineers, and Data Engineers to execute and deliver the 2022 Roadmap, which includes a variety ML-driven solution to enhance how Customers are matched with solutions (human or automated).     Define business and systems requirements working with internal and external customers.     Work closely with the Routing BIEs to monitor the performance of new and existing routing solutions (including ML models) and surface new opportunities for improvements. To do so, you will analyze key metrics and own ad-hoc deep dive investigations into existing routing journeys to identify the root cause of issues and surface improvement opportunities.     Look for synergies between products in the organization and make recommendations to leadership on how to implement new ideas, mechanisms, and scale existing ones.     Clearly communicate goals, roles, responsibilities, and desired outcomes.     Liaise with all departments to ensure relevant areas are engaged in time to develop deliverables within their area to support project deliverables. Support partner teams to refine processes and increase efficiency in line with program objectives.     Track delivery against program objectives and implement proposals to improve program services and efficiencies.     Scale existing programs to expand coverage of existing services or programs to additional domestic and international locations.     Ideate and drive strategic change across the broader D2AS team.     About the team   Routing is the process that pairs Amazon Customers with the best solution to resolve their issue in a timely manner. As the D2-GPS Team, our mission is to deliver a better support experience by optimizing and personalizing the pairing of Customers to the appropriate solution available (human or automated). We do so by leveraging machine learning (ML) and strategic rule-based solutions to predict the Customer's issue (Contact Intent) and intelligently route the Customer to the best solution available throughout the end-to-end (E2E) support journey, be it a self-service workflow or Customer Service Associate.            Experience influencing and leading without direct management authority     Experience defining, planning, and driving the execution of complex products/programs from initiation to delivery     Ability to interpret data, find root causes, and make business recommendations• Experience working cross-functionally with both science and engineering teams     Master’s Degree or MBA in a related discipline.     Proficient oral and written communication, as well as the ability to persuade, inspire, and motivate others.     Experience in process improvement using Lean and Kaizen methods.     Intuitive understanding of optimal versus sub-optimal customer experiences, with ability to quickly assess the situation and identify solutions to improve/fix.     Knowledge of customer Customer Service operations or technical support     Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Do you have passion for defining the Customer’s Support Experience with Gaming, Devices and Social support? Do you believe Customer satisfaction is core to the success of any business? Do you thrive on analyzing data, customer feedback and industry trends to inform the core strategies that will move Customer Support forward? Are you someone with a passion to solve real world business problems with data, analytics, machine learning and AI? Do you thrive in a fast-paced and complex work environment where ambiguity is the norm? If you have answered yes to these questions, then this role may be for you.          As Microsoft transforms to help customers achieve more in a mobile-first and cloud-first world, support plays a critical role. To do this, we must deeply understand customers' real needs, designing, implementing, and delivering support experiences that meet those needs. Support Planners spend time and think deeply on our customers support experiences, understanding the challenges and detailing areas for improvement or innovations, with the goal of making support experiences effortless.          This role is focused on Support for Gaming, Devices and Social scenarios. We boldly pursue big ideas that power transformational advances at Microsoft and for our customers, while helping Microsoft teams work smarter, faster, and more securely every day. You will work on all aspects of the design, development, and delivery of analytics and machine learning to create applicable solutions/outputs. You will work with a range of business stakeholders to define problems, construct hypotheses, design experiments, and to implement changes that drive customer value creation. We have deep technical and business expertise, customer insights, and a clear point of view that comes from first-hand, large-scale experience with Microsoft and industry solutions. We have exciting opportunities for you to innovate, influence, transform, inspire, and grow within our organization and we encourage you to apply to learn more! Ensure data accuracy        Qualifications        Required Qualifications:       This role will partner with engineers, program managers, and data scientists to turn our data into actionable learnings to directly influence product roadmap and implementation.         3+ years product / technical data analyst experience OR Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Science, Business, or a related field with documented coursework in statistics or business analytics      Strong data exploration techniques using languages such as Kusto, SQL and Python      Ability to help define hypothesis, requirements, metrics, and application with both business and technical partners.      Ability to work through ambiguity and flexible to work across various areas and projects.      Ability to understand, translate and map business and product questions into analysis projects.               Preferred Qualifications:           Exceptional problem solving, technical and data analysis skills      Working knowledge of large data manipulation and data mining      Exceptional written and verbal communication and presentation skills      Be self-driven, and show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete or dirty data      Ability to work in a team environment that promotes collaboration      Be able to and succeed in a matrix structure by influencing new thinking        Innate curiosity and ability to thrive in an ambiguous and rapidly changing startup environment. Self-starters and innovators with a positive, collaborative can-do attitude, growth mindset and bias for action        Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. job_title: Artificial Intelligence R&D Technologist - Associate Level
job_Description: At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us. Boeing Global Talent Acquisition is currently looking for  Artificial Intelligence R&D Technologists - Associate Level  to join their Intelligent Solutions team in  Tukwila, WA . These positions will focus on supporting the Boeing Research & Technology (BR&T) organization. As the advanced central research and development organization of The Boeing Company, Boeing Research & Technology (BR&T) provides innovative technologies that enable the development of future aerospace solutions while improving the cycle time, cost, quality and performance of existing Boeing products and services. Employees work in a dynamic and distributed environment where the initiative and contribution of each team member is critical to success. The ideal candidate will be able to work independently and as part of a distributed (and international) team. Many projects are multi-year and end with the successful transition and integration of new capabilities to Boeing end product development/deployment. Project work can be funded by Independent Research and Development, Contracted Research and Development, or support to a business unit. A successful candidate will be a motivated and independent early career Artificial Intelligence Technologist with coding experience, data understanding, and machine learning knowledge. They will assist in research and development (R&D) and rapidly prototype advanced computing technologies for aerospace products and services. They will be comfortable in taking initiative, learning by experience, possess an interest in personal learning, seek feedback from others, and create innovative ideas. They will get great satisfaction in applying and engineering solutions that will work in the real world. Position Responsibilities: Develops advanced software and models for aerospace products and services Adapts and integrates various software packages into workable prototypes Designs, applies, and crafts new algorithms, methods, and tools addressing project requirements Participates in the software development and machine learning development processes Evaluates performance of algorithms as well as general ability to select and apply algorithms to meet application requirements with respect to scalability Collects, prioritizes, synthesizes, and analyzes data; summarizes findings; develops conclusions and recommendations Includes the ability to integrate application components and databases across computing platforms Provides solutions to a variety of technical problems of moderate scope and complexity Works under general supervision, and no instructions are needed for routine work Leverages knowledge of Artificial Intelligence approaches and techniques Optimally communicates results to teammates and customers Demonstrates an interest in personal learning and development Seeks feedback from multiple sources to improve and develop Comfortable in taking initiative and learning by experience This position allows telecommuting. The selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at one of the listed location options. The position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a “U.S. Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15 is required. “U.S. Person” includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee. Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience): Experience developing and deploying software programs Experience developing and evaluating learned models Experience preparing data to create learned models Experience with scripting languages for prototyping such as Python, MATLAB 1+ years of experience with programming languages such a C++, C, Java Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience): Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics or similar 2 years relevant experience including jobs, internships and assistantships Experience with software frameworks such as Robot Operating System (ROS) Experience with Linux OS Experience with machine learning libraries, such as TensorFlow, Keras or PyTorch Experience with machine learning techniques, such as Support Vector Machines, Heuristics, Neural Nets, Markov Decision Experience with Machine Learning development and deployment pipeline, i.e. from data to model Knowledge of data structure, numerical optimization and algorithm complexity Experience with Agile methodology and repositories, such as JIRA and Git Typical Education & Experience: Typically 2 or more years' related work or military experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience. Advanced degree (e.g. Bachelor, Master, etc.) preferred, but not required. Relocation: This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility. Drug Free Workplace: Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies. Shift: This position is for 1st shift Equal Opportunity Employer: Boeing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems or related field     Passion for technology and Machine Learning     Strong track record of shaping business strategy for technical products or services     Superior written and verbal communications skills     Superior analytical and quantitative skills; experience in data collection, model building, testing and validation.     Experience translating customer needs into innovative and detailed product requirements for customer-facing online and mobile products/services     Experience working with customers, technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs     Exceptional attention to detail, organizational, and project management skills     Job summary   The AI team within AWS is responsible for setting the AI strategy and delivering machine learning services across multiple segments and requirements to AWS customers.      In this role, you will be getting in on the ground floor of a new project to bring machine learning and deep learning to more developers worldwide. You'll use your passion for technology and solving customer problems to develop and drive product plans to develop an exciting offering for customers.      As a Principal Product Manager, you will be part of the larger product leadership community at AWS. This community plays a critical role in the broad business planning, working closely with senior executives to develop business targets and resource requirements, influences our long-term technical and business strategy, helps us hire talented team of PMs and ultimately enables us to deliver innovative new solutions rapidly. You will be seen as the subject matter expert for your area of focus within Amazon AI.      A successful candidate will bring a passion for technology services, strong business acumen and judgment, ability to define visionary, ground breaking products, desire to have an industry wide impact and ability to work within a fast moving environment in a large company to rapidly deliver services that have a broad business impact.      You will manage and be responsible for understanding customer needs and delivering some of our most strategic technical projects, and have a significant bottom-line impact on our business and competitive position.        Your responsibilities will include:    Lead Product Definition – Own and drive the customer working backwards strategy, tenets, long-term goals and working backwards documents (press release, FAQ) including customer and market feedback, competitive analysis and business metrics to inform direction.   Define Product Vision – Including all aspects to future roadmap, investment, innovation and experimentation.   Execution of Product Planning and Development – Including customer goals and business requirements for product release, ensuring implementation is aligned with product goals and requirements, and ownership of product positioning.      Lead Product Launch – Own the GTM plan to deliver results that ensure the customer and business goals are met in operational launch plans.      Lead Operations – Including monitoring and response to customer feedback, continuous improvement and business growth      Lead interaction with Technical Team – Including helping the technical team make tradeoffs based on customer requirements, QA/testing of the product.      Lead and mentor technical product managers      Influence senior leaders across Amazon and communicate Amazon AI’s vision, strategy, goals, status, and customer impact      Inclusive Team Culture   Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences.      Work/Life Balance   Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.      Mentorship & Career Growth   Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.            Must have shipped a customer- or developer-facing product or service     Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science or related field     Experience building businesses from the ground up     Experience leading engineering and product teams     Experience applying machine learning approaches to complex problems.     Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers at scale     Job summary   Amazon’s Choice makes shopping simpler and more fulfilling for customers. By curating products at massive scale, and highlighting them when they resonate most with customers, Amazon's Choice earns customers' trust as a reliable resource for shopping decisions, and helps them complete billions of purchases worldwide each year on Amazon stores and Alexa. This also creates an opportunity to help customers make even better shopping decisions, and accelerate Amazon flywheel, creating billions of dollars of incremental value along the way. We are looking for a senior leader to take this program to the next level, leading a group of experienced engineers, scientists and product managers, and partnering with key stakeholders across Amazon, to invent, build and scale the product, technology and science that will magically help customers simplify their shopping and increase satisfaction with their purchase.   The ideal candidate will be comfortable building, growing, inspiring and leading a functionally diverse team to:         Develop a strong product vision to grow Amazon's Choice value to customers     Evolve the technical strategy for web-scale reliability, with extension points and experimentation capabilities that enable rapid iteration on incremental features and CX.     Leverage science (e.g., deep learning, reinforcement learning, economics) to create unparalleled trust and convenience     Define success metrics and valuation frameworks, and build the data infrastructure to support them.     Partner strategically with stakeholder teams across Amazon to leverage their capabilities in Amazon's Choice and/or leverage Amazon's Choice capabilities to help them achieve their goals.     Key job responsibilities   This leader is responsible for hiring and developing a highly technical team, rapidly inventing and shipping new experiences that redefine convenience in shopping at Amazon stores, and with Alexa.      A day in the life   This leader will help reshape how Amazon customers search, browse and engage with recommendations to improve the shopping experience WW, qualifying, ranking and curating highly relevant products to highlight for customers. They will will work closely with: Alexa, Search, Personalization, Pricing, Delivery Experience, and Seller teams, drafting working back documents, technical strategies, and UI/UX designs.            Strong understanding of the technology and product development lifecycle, and experience designing and delivering best in class products.     Experience managing teams applying Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.     Experience building global solutions.     High judgment on customer- or business-related decisions, including one-way doors.     A passion for people management and mentorship; hiring and developing great people; growing a diverse team and an inclusive culture.     Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Hands on experience with scripting/coding.      4+ year of experience working as a Quality Assurance Engineer      Experience in manual testing      Experience in automation testing      BS in Computer Science or 4+ years equivalent combination of technical education and work experience.      Defining test plans and test strategies for medium to large sized features      Troubleshooting/Debugging experience      Able to think and act both strategically and tactically to deal with ambiguity, manage changing priorities, and influence others.      Strong oral and written communication skills, as well as the ability to think clearly and analytically, problem solving, scope business requirements, and prioritize work on projects.      Willing to travel when needed            Job summary  Amazon Go is a new kind of store with no lines and no checkout—you just grab and go! Customers simply use the Amazon Go app to enter the store, take what they want from our selection of fresh, delicious meals and grocery essentials, and go!    Our checkout-free shopping experience is made possible by our Just Walk Out Technology, which automatically detects when products are taken from or returned to the shelves and keeps track of them in a virtual cart. When you’re done shopping, you can just leave the store. Shortly after, we’ll charge your Amazon account and send you a receipt. Check it out at amazon.com/go. Designed and custom-built by Amazonians, our Just Walk Out Technology uses a variety of technologies including computer vision, sensor fusion, and advanced machine learning. Innovation is part of our DNA! Our goal is to be Earths’ most customer centric company and we are just getting started. We need people who want to join an ambitious program that continues to push the state of the art in computer vision, machine learning, distributed systems and hardware design.    The Role: Everyone on the team needs to be entrepreneurial, wear many hats and work in a highly collaborative environment that’s more startup than big company. We’ll tackle problems that span a variety of domains: computer vision, image recognition, machine learning, real-time and distributed systems.    As a QA Engineer, you will help tackle a variety of technical challenges. You will work with research, engineering and product management to define next generation of JWO Tech. Given that this is an early-stage initiative, you will play an active role in translating business and functional requirements into concrete deliverables and build automation, and work in partnership with other technology leaders within the team.    You should be comfortable with a degree of ambiguity that’s higher than most projects and relish the idea of solving problems that frankly, haven’t been solved at scale before - anywhere. You will tackle challenging, novel situations every day and given the size of this initiative, you’ll have the opportunity to work with multiple technical teams at Amazon in different locations. Along the way, we guarantee that you’ll learn a ton, have fun and make a positive impact on millions of people.              Ability to review or troubleshoot code in at least one modern programmng language      Experience in automation      Maintain a high quality bar by constantly improving existing QA practices.      Creating/Maintaining high quality testing documentation        Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. The Role The ideal candidate will have deep experience in building and leading a sales organization, primarily in a B2B technology start-up, especially a SaaS-based company.  A candidate must have a background working in the mining industry,  and no less than 5 years selling into the global mining industry. Reporting to the CEO, with a dotted line to the COO  Based in Seattle, Vancouver, Toronto, or Denver, this executive will serve as a sales lead for the company, with responsibility for building a robust pipeline and delivering on quarterly and annual revenue targets.  Build a strong sales operations infrastructure, including optimizing the CRM system, creating sales materials (in conjunction with marketing), training, and RFP management.  Build, lead and manage a high performance sales team, with sales people located in different regions worldwide.  Coordinate closely with DataCloud’s marketing VP, COO and CTO to ensure that DataCloud’s products and solutions are aligned with feedback from the marketplace.  Manage DataCloud’s presence at major industry events and serve as key representative for the company at these events. Key Qualifications   Ability to “function as an island,” and build a best in class sales organization that specializes in selling transformative new technology to an industry that is ripe for, but resistant to, disruption.  Must be a true self-starter, comfortable functioning without a roadmap. Must strongly want the opportunity and autonomy to decide how best to capitalize on a stunningly large market that will require flexibility and the ability to deal effectively with ambiguity.  Must possess DNA that doesn’t allow you to take “no” for an answer.  Ideally, the candidate will have an understanding of mining engineering or related/equivalent geo-technical subject matter expertise.  Should have contacts with the major mining companies based in and around Canada.  Strong analytical and quantitative skills – not afraid to dive deep into subject related data and ask the right questions and be able to chart a path to answer them.  Quick learner, willing to study and digest and comprehend new concepts fast, in an ever changing environment.  This leadership sales job is based in North America.  Ability to travel to remote client mining sites as needed (travel is typically anticipated to be less than 25% initially).  Excellent balance of people, organizational, technical, and communication skills.  Ability to manage multiple concurrent major projects  Excellent trade-off management in achieving tactical and strategic objectives.  Ability to successfully influence others to best outcomes even when they are not in your organization. DataCloud is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, military status, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under applicable local law. The Candidate must be authorized to work in USA or Canada. About DataCloud Founded in 2016, DataCloud delivers high-resolution rock mass characterization data to our clients in real-time. Our innovative measurement and analysis platform provides invaluable orebody insights during drill and blast operations. Our technologies help mine planning teams to dramatically improve their extraction efficiencies. With our unique combination of skills in both mining and technology, DataCloud is helping to solve many of the problems that have challenged the mining industry for decades. Our founders come from institutions such as Stanford, UC-Berkeley and Cambridge, who have expertise in geosciences and cloud architecture.  Our portfolio of products and services span the latest in Geo-Statistics, Geo-Physics, and advanced digital and artificial intelligence technologies, including cloud computing, machine learning, advanced visualization, and new sensor technology enabled by IoT systems.

job_title: Product Manager, Selling Partner Support WW Defect Elimination
job_Description: 5+ years of experience driving business results     2+ years as a product manager delivering technology-based solutions or equivalent experience     Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering, computer science, design or a related field     Experience working with software engineers and leading large-scale initiatives with cross-functional stakeholders     Experience using data and metrics to develop business cases, validate assumptions and design amazing products.     Track record of influencing and driving change through diverse stakeholder groups.           Job summary    Customer Trust & Partner Support (CTPS) is responsible for creating a trustworthy shopping experience across Amazon stores worldwide by protecting Customers, Brands, Selling Partners and Amazon from fraud, counterfeit, and abuse as well as empowering, providing world‐class support, and building loyalty with Amazon’s millions of selling partners. We value individual expression, respect different opinions, and work together to create a culture where each of us is able to contribute fully. Our unique backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our ability to achieve Amazon's mission of being Earth's most customer-centric company.    We strive to make Amazon the best way for Partners to reach customers locally and globally and to operate their businesses, driven by the accurate and efficient support and solutions we provide them.         PSAS (Partner Solutions and Support) focuses on both preventing Selling Partner (Seller, Vendor and Brand Registry) contacts through preventing issues based on knowledge obtained during our support interactions, and for handling those contacts with quality and efficiency. To achieve this vision, we invest in technology to eliminate the root cause defects that cause Selling Partners to seek help, build self-service tools to resolve their issues on their own without waiting for help from Amazon, and provide Associates with the tools that automate routine steps and help them deliver consistent, efficient, quality resolution. We also make daily adjustments throughout our global network to meet the needs of our Selling Partners, employees, and the business. Our team includes product managers, program managers, SDEs, scientists, and a range of operational and other specialty roles, and we operate at scale with over 17K Amazonians in our team, spanning 50+ global locations, and handling over 85M contacts a year.        Are you an innovator who is excited by the opportunity to be at the forefront of redefining the way Amazon enables Selling Partner success? Are you looking for a place where you’ll be valued for your ability to cut through ambiguity and define, develop and deliver game changing products that are simple to use? Do you want to drive change at global scale, impacting millions of users around the world?        The PSAS team is looking for a Product Manager who will have cross functional responsibilities to drive improvements in the Worldwide (WW) Selling Partner experience by fundamentally removing their need for support. This role requires working with and influencing Amazon product teams across businesses and geographies, removing defects in the Selling experience resulting in a direct reduction in contacts and overall cost savings. The leader will be passionate about customer experience, innovation, and cross-team partnerships to deliver business impact. You will build programs that deliver a better selling experience by partnering with multiple Program, Product and Tech Teams. This position involves regular interactions with senior management on status, risks and is a key contributor to weekly Consumer mechanisms.        In this role you'll get the opportunity to:            Advocate on behalf of the Selling Partners, from the identification of defects that prevent success, to driving resolution of the most impactful issues with the teams that own the product.      Influence the product strategy and vision for key functionality in a large-scale technology product, developing short, medium and long-term features.      Set goals which align cross-team contributions and measure progress towards achieve the vision.      Contribute to the product roadmap, driving prioritization and trade-off decisions within and outside of the team      Champion and gain buy-in for solutions from partner teams through collaboration, documentation, and negotiation that effectively influences peers and senior management.      Drive effective teamwork, communication, collaboration, and commitment across multiple groups with competing priorities.                   Experience managing worldwide customer-facing products in e-commerce, retail, or digital customer service across a variety of devices.      Experience working with call centers, support automation, workflows, machine learning, and/or web content.      Experience working on products in a high-volume, operational environment        Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Summary  Posted: Apr 27, 2022  Role Number: 200372739  Our organization is looking for a Software Engineer who wants to meaningfully impact the lives of our users. This team is working with some of Apple’s most advanced technologies including augmented reality (AR), virtual reality (VR), machine learning (ML), and computer vision (CV). As a member of our organization, you will have a uniquely rewarding opportunity to drive future products that will delight and inspire millions of people every single day.  Key Qualifications  3+ years of experience in software development.  Proficiency in a programming language such as C, C++, Objective-C, Swift, etc.  Excellent communication and collaboration skills  Enthusiastic about working on a cross functional team  Creativity, passion and excitement for building products that positively impact the lives of our users  Attention to details for delivering high quality experiences  Experience developing 3D or AR/VR applications or games is a big plus  Description  As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to develop high-quality experiences using bleeding edge technology that will meaningfully impact the lives of our users. We work closely with Apple's Human Interface design team and our internal framework teams to define and develop high-impact applications for Apple platforms. The ideal candidate for this role is comfortable working in a dynamic and creative environment. You will be researching and developing an entirely new application paradigm - a challenge that will demand rapid experimentation and prototyping without sacrificing code quality or attention to details. You will need a keen understanding of 3D applications or are eager to learn this new skill. You will work closely with artists, designers and engineers to define and prove new application concepts and UX paradigms, and solve incredibly challenging and interesting problems in the AR/VR space. As a member of the team, you will have a unique opportunity to explore a new world of uncharted possibilities and bring new experiences to life.  Education & Experience  BS / MS / PhD in Computer Science OR equivalent degree OR equivalent experience  Additional Requirements  Experience with iOS frameworks such as ARKit, UIKit, RealityKit, HealthKit, Core Motion, Metal etc.  Excellent understanding of the practical applications of linear algebra  Familiarity with other AR SDKs such as ARCore, Vuforia or similar tools.  Proficiency with Unity, Unreal, or similar 3D engines.

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:    Seattle, WA, USA; Pittsburgh, PA, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USA .    Minimum qualifications:          Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent practical experience      15 years of experience with system design, algorithms, data structures, complexity analysis, software design in Unix/Linux systems, performance, and application issues      15 years of experience managing, growing, and building a team of engineers      Experience working with stakeholders and cross-functionally        Preferred qualifications:          Advanced degree      Experience working in software product development, global scale serving systems, and/or machine learning      Ability to perform in-depth, technical searches into code, networking, operating systems, and storage      Ability to utilize verbal and agile skills to engage in strategy discussions with executive teams      Ability to speak and write in English fluently, with excellent written and verbal communication skills      Ability to represent complex business or technical concepts externally            About the job      Google Ads supports a free and open internet, as well as funds Google's innovation more broadly. Today, Google Ads is a complex set of systems that interoperate with each other and most of the Google products and services.      As a Director in Ads Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), you will lead global teams to protect Google's business growth from production outages, but more importantly to ensure that the systems work appropriately and safely for our advertisers and end-users.      Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) focuses on production health to prevent outages and it does so by defining and developing deep software engineering solutions which simplify the operating environment and make not only Google Ads reliable, but also make feature development faster and safer. Alongside this work, SRE will also focus on efficiency, helping Ads find ways to sustainably scale and open up avenues for more innovation.      In this role, you will partner with feature development organizations: one developing systems for Advertiser engagement (Google Ads), the other protecting our advertisers and users from harm. Both are core infrastructure used throughout the Ads ecosystem, and are critical to its function and success. Ultimately, you will lead a global team of engineers, and partner with developers to help Ads deliver on its mission to power the open and free internet with the best technology that connects users and businesses everywhere.               Responsibilities           Own, innovate, and create programs, new software, and analytics that drive improvements to the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of a subset of Google’s products and/or services.       Manage on-call rotations of engineers across continents, using a 24-hour support model.       Work cross-functionally with product area leads from technologies across Google's deep stack to guide product engineering to build fast, reliable, and durable production systems.       Collaborate with teams building Google’s hardware and data centers and technical infrastructure.       Manage, lead, and grow a team of Site Reliability Engineers.         Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
